DarkHawk:

"Always Exist a way to get that information" said Darkhwak "In f=
act, I 'know' how to; but I'm feeling in good mood today, Scrapling, in spi=
te of all the trouble you have done... but, I wil ask nicely first: Where i=
s the Ark?"


From: Preston Carroll 
Sent: Wednesday, February 24, 2010 3:3=
6 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortr=
ess


  
> " Uh ohh, I - think I lost my sonar transmitter someplace.. Hmm,=
 must have gotten destroyed in the heat of the fight. Too bad, because that=
 was - the only link I had to the - Ark. Being sight impaired finding my wa=
y is next to - near impossible. Wow, you - sure got me good this time. How =
unfortunate... All that power, lost in an unknown area of this planet, with=
 no way of locating it. I'm sorry, but without that device, I can not find =
the Ark let alone see anything in front of my face."
>
> He gave up the inf=
ormation he knew he could give to them safely. The rest he keeps quiet.

Sc=
orponok chuckled darkly, his voice sounding far more deep and
resonant than=
 Zarak's did. "You think we need the location of the
Ark?" he asked as he r=
eached up with a clawed hand to lightly tap on
Tuscon's helm, running the b=
lade of the claw along it, "It's not the
location that we need, it's the sp=
ecification, your understanding of
it."

Scorponok looked over at the tortu=
re controls and then back at Tuscon,
"And believe me, you will reveal it to=
 us, in fact, you will be
begging to tell us everything you know." Scorpono=
k intoned, his voice
if anything deeper and more threatening. "And then, if=
 I'm feeling
indulgent, I will be ready to listen."

Preston
(Scorponok)
